intro: Musa ensete var. montbeliardii, commonly known as the Montbeliard banana, is a variant of the enset plant native to Ethiopia. It is a tall, herbaceous plant that can grow up to 10 meters in height, characterized by its large, elongated leaves. The plant produces clusters of bananas that are typically harvested when they are still green. Its botanical structure includes a pseudostem formed by tightly packed leaf sheaths, and it has a fibrous root system. This species is valued for both its ornamental qualities and its potential agricultural uses.
